su_1683043: $ file="$(
curl -s https://api.github.com/repos/kgns/weapons/releases/latest \
| grep browser_download_url \
| sed -re 's/.*: "([^"]+)".*/\1/' \
)"

$ echo ${file##*/}
weapons-v1.7.5.zip

Top-3 Similar Questions: so_53134352: How to download images from Google with terminal? (Mac)
so_27909521: download images from google with command line
su_1683043: How to download the latest release from github and extract the zip in a folder using bash
Top-3 Scripts:
so_27909521: $ count=10
$ imagelink=$(wget --user-agent 'Mozilla/5.0' -qO - "www.google.be/search?q=something\&tbm=isch" | sed 's/</\n</g' | grep '<img' | head -n"$count" | tail -n1 | sed 's/.*src="\([^"]*\)".*/\1/')
$ wget $imagelink

#! /bin/bash
count=${1}
shift
query="$@"
[ -z $query ] && exit 1  # insufficient arguments
imagelink=$(wget --user-agent 'Mozilla/5.0' -qO - | "www.google.be/search?q=${query}\&tbm=isch" | sed 's/</\n</g' | grep '<img' | head -n"$count" | tail -n1 | sed 's/.*src="\([^"]*\)".*/\1/')
wget -qO google_image $imagelink
